docs.lead_paragraph: STRANGE OCCURRENCE.--On Thursday, a large party, mostly Germans, went on a pic-nic excursion to the Miami Grove up the river, on the steamer Champion. They were accompanied by a band of music, and the principal amusement was dancing. During the day a German by the name of CHOLER was taken suddenly ill, and died on the boat while returning to the city.

headline.main: The Health of Bullalo--The Overdue Interest on City Bonds.

NEW-YORK CITY.; The Chelera. Affray between the Turners and the Irish. Robbing a Sontberner of U. S. Con. The recent attempted Arson in Fron-street--Testimonial to Watchman White. Alleged Arson. CRYSTAL PALACE. Hudson River ?? Company--Indignation Meeting. A SHREWD OPERATION. RECKLESS DRIVING AND LOSS OF LIFE. NEARLY DROWNED.
COLLEGE COMMENCEMENTS.; Old "Union" in Commotion--Great Times in Schenectady.

docs.lead_paragraph: It rains. Schenectady is fully full. There is no telling how many houseless people are even now traveling the streets of this hospitable, wide-spread-out, and comfortable town--drenched, umbrellaless, and hungry.
docs.snippet: It rains. Schenectady is fully full. There is no telling how many houseless people are even now traveling the streets of this hospitable, wide-spread-out, and comfortable town--drenched, umbrellaless, and hungry.

byline.original: Special Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: FRANCE.; THE OZAR AND RUSSIAN AFFAIRS. The Fourth of July in Paris--Miscellaneous Intelligence.

docs.lead_paragraph: The English journals are just now unusually full of eye-witnessed intelligence from the various seats of war, highly encouraging to the allies, and very dispiriting for the Russians. This is natural, and even necessary.
docs.snippet: The English journals are just now unusually full of eye-witnessed intelligence from the various seats of war, highly encouraging to the allies, and very dispiriting for the Russians. This is natural, and even necessary.

byline.original: Special Correspondence to the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: If a citizen go into the country now, almost the first question asked him is concerning the extent and fatality of the cholera here.
docs.snippet: If a citizen go into the country now, almost the first question asked him is concerning the extent and fatality of the cholera here.

headline.main: Frightful Ravages of the Cholera near Niagara Falls, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Reports having reached here on Saturday of the sudden outbreak of cholera at Niagara Falls, Drs. HAMILTON and HUNT repaired to the spot, and found it aging among the Irish laborers, on the Canal and the ? grounds at the Suspension Bridge.
docs.snippet: Reports having reached here on Saturday of the sudden outbreak of cholera at Niagara Falls, Drs. HAMILTON and HUNT repaired to the spot, and found it aging among the Irish laborers, on the Canal and the ? grounds at the Suspension Bridge.

headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; By Telegraph to the New-York Daily Times. FROM WASHINGTON. Ratification of the Russian Treaty. Alterations of the Minnesota Land Bill. Schuyler and other New-York and Albany Railroad Me_ Interested. THE NEW-HAMPSHIRE VACANCY. CIVIL AND DIPLOMATIC BILL. Appropriation for the Payment of the President's Household Officials. PROGRESS OF THE NAVY APPROPRIATION BILL

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate ratified the Russian Treaty immediately on receiving it. It guarantees the neutrality of the United States in the present war, and establishes as a principle of national law, that free ships make free goods, and that the property of neutrals, unless contraband of war, shall be respected, even when on board of enemy's vessels.
